items.title: Technical Project Lead at Integrated Data Services (IDS) (Los Angeles, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
Technical Project Lead

Integrated Data Services (IDS)

Job Description

Technical Project Lead
Boston, MA – Washington, DC – Dayton, OH – El Segundo, CA

Company Overview:

Integrated Data Services, Inc. (IDS) is a leading provider of custom software products and Government financial management services. IDS was founded in 1997 in El Segundo, CA, and since that time has seen tremendous growth and success. Currently IDS has offices supporting customers nationwide. By providing customers with fast, efficient and reliable information systems and support services, IDS has become a preferred provider of financial and programmatic systems, services, and solutions across a wide variety of Government agencies.

Job description:

IDS is seeking an ambitious self-starter to lead software development projects. The position requires proven analytical capabilities, strong persuasive writing skills, and the tenacity to develop ideas independently and thrive in a fast-paced environment. The position will work with teams leveraging numerous technologies with an emphasis on new-build web applications, data integration and system interfaces.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Work with customers, stakeholders and subject matter experts to gain a deep understanding of the software requirements and underlying business processes.
  • Actively participate in the software development process to include requirements analysis, user interface design, data modeling, design document preparation, testing, demonstrating and training.
  • Leverage functional expertise and problem solving skills to guide and support software development teams.
  • Prioritize software development efforts and utilize development team resources to deliver high quality software applications and interfaces.
  • Present status of software projects and identify options and solutions to resolve issues.
  • Elicit customer feedback to discover new feature requests and identify product improvements.
  • Demonstrate software applications and new capabilities to customers.
  • Demonstrate software applications and train team members on new capabilities.
  • When needed, provide functional support to customers and resolve issues with current functionality in a timely manner.

Knowledge and Skills:

  • At least 5 years of experience supporting software applications or working with software development teams.
  • Ability to interface effectively with team members from all functional disciplines as well as senior management.
  • Ability to collaborate and communicate with customers and the software end-users.
  • Exceptional problem solving skills and the ability to rapidly analyze complex technology and business scenarios.
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills focused on the ability to guide interdisciplinary teams through software projects.
  • Critical thinker, expected to speak out and defend views.
  • Experience with our existing software applications and systems: CCaR™, Executive CCaR™ and PMRT; is desired.
  • Experience with Department of Defense (DoD) finance, contracting, acquisition and logistics systems is desired.
  • Experience with Atlassian JIRA and Confluence a plus.

Education and Work Experience:

This position requires a minimum of a 4-year degree from an accredited college or university in business management, information technology, computer science, or other related discipline.

Certificates and Licenses:

Applicants selected for employment will be subject to a Federal background investigation and must meet additional eligibility requirements for access to classified information or materials.

Travel:

Some travel may be required.

Hours:

Normal work schedule will be 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M., Monday through Friday.  May be required to work additional hours and/or weekends, as needed, to meet deadlines or to fulfill travel obligations.

Salary Range:

Commensurate with experience.

Company offers full-benefits package including health, dental, vision and 401K plans.  IDS is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, creed, age, sex, gender, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, ancestry, pregnancy, perceived pregnancy, medical condition, marital status, familial status, color, religion, uniformed services, veteran status, national origin, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected under local, state or Federal law.  A submission of a resume is an expression of interest and not considered an application. 

For more information, visit www.get-integrated.com. To apply, please send a resume and cover letter to jobs@get-integrated.com and reference code: IDS-TPL-VL.

**U.S. citizenship and/or green card is required; H1-B visas and other visas are not being sponsored. Relocation expenses are NOT compensated. All jobs are employer paid; no fees to candidates. Third parties or agencies inquiries are not being accepted.**

Senior UI Developer

Integrated Data Services (IDS)

Job Description

Senior UI Developer

Los Angeles, CA; Washington D.C.; Rochester, NY; Dayton, OH

Company Overview:

Integrated Data Services, Inc. (IDS) is a leading provider of custom software products and Government financial management services. items.title: Frontend Integration Engineer at Clicktripz (Manhattan Beach, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
Frontend Integration Engineer

Clicktripz

Job Description

Clicktripz is looking for a talented front-end developer. This is a full-time position and the developer would be able to work remotely while communicating with our office in Manhattan Beach, California.

The ideal candidate is a motivated self-starter who can work creating flexible solutions that reach the goals and business needs of our customers. This person must be comfortable assuming ownership of projects and be able to adapt to changing requirements. 

Please do not apply if you are not located in the United States

Responsibilities

  • Integrate ClickTripz products onto some of the largest travel websites in the world.
  • Maintain on-going partner integrations.
  • Spec and implement new JS products for the Clicktripz 3rd party suite.
  • Kill 10 Mudbelly boards and bring me their pelts... but don't hurt yourself now!
  • Troubleshoot any issues regarding front-end solutions, thinking creatively on how to implement solutions.

Skills & Requirements

  • You have a strong software development fundamentals through your Bachelor's Degree in CS or have a related degree or experience.
  • You have experience building production-level websites, and you have a solid understanding of the web stack.
  • You have an intimate understanding of how browsers work, and have experience building cross browser functionality.
  • You preferably have experience building 3rd party javascript solutions.
  • You have great attention to detail, with a meticulous mindset.
  • Great communication skills. We are a remote-based company. 
  • Sample of code or products you have worked on. Github profile is a plus.

About Clicktripz

Clicktripz believes in an advertising network that’s a win for all parties involved. Publishers can monetize their website using a fully customizable ad-widget and receive the highest revenue share in the industry. Live metric data is freely given and easily accessible through a reporting site. Advertisers have access to metrics and fine grained targeting. This allows them to find and purchase the traffic that works best for them. On top of all this, the Clicktripz team provides support to its customers. This support helps them be their best, and ensures the network works for them. Clicktripz is a growing company that started in 2010 with 3 people, today the team has grown to 45 members and is still expanding. The technological back-end runs on a large scale, serving millions of advertisements per day. The growing workload and potential business means Clicktripz needs your help. Clicktripz does all work remotely with a small office in Manhattan Beach, CA. This is a great environment if you communicate well with the team, are self-driven, and manage your own time. The combination of a small development team and the steady addition of new features provides a lot of room to learn and grow.

items.title: Data Integration Engineer
items.content:
Concirrus creates revolutionary software products that are disrupting and transforming the Insurance industry. We are entering an exciting period of growth and are looking to hire a Data Integration Engineer to focus on solutions for our Insurtech customers and products.

Our company is growing, grow with us.

The Role:
The Data Integration Engineer will be responsible for integrating a wide variety of data mediums, real-time, time-series, transactional, scraped and batch into our content ecosystem and make ready for advanced data mining and analytics. Using best of breed tools and methods you will process this data efficiently, consistently and securely working in our London office alongside our data science team, customers and content providers. This is an exciting and rewarding role requiring a smart and expedient approach to data integration and ETL.

The Candidate:
You will be an experienced software engineer who has developed and implemented advanced data integration solutions in a commercial environment previously. Having worked in customer-facing roles you will have the proven ability to collaborate, to participate in the development of and confidently execute data integration/transformation solutions. The right candidate will also enjoy taking the initiative and performing to a high standard within a fast paced & cutting edge environment.

Key Responsibilities:

● Engage directly with customers and content providers to participate in design and development of data integration/transformation solution according to functional requirements
● Create and implement advanced data integration solutions and environment.
● Clean and transform batch, time-series and real-time data into Lambda architecture.
● Support, monitor, execute production application jobs and processes.
● Perform debugging, troubleshooting, modifications and unit testing of integration solutions
● Participate in the development of documentation, technical procedures and user support guides.

Experience:

*3+ years solid commercial experience with system/data integration, development or implementation of enterprise and/or cloud software.

*Technically savvy with major implementation technologies including Web services, enterprise data integration and ETL tools.

*Experience with relational and nonrelational databases (any vendor).

*Software house experience, comfortable taking the initiative and getting a high quality job done within tight (agreed) timeframes

The important skills:

*Languages: Java, Python

*Integration: Apache NiFi, Postman, REST, Spring Boot.

*Stack: Apache Kibana / Elasticsearch, Spark.

*Database: SQL, Cassandra, RedShift, MongoDB, Postgre.

The skills we are also interested in:

*Experience of data integration with RStudio and ML models.

*Insurance Enterprise Systems: Guidewire, SAS, Transactor, PolicyWriter.

*Experience of GIS data.

*Comprehensive automated testing experience, continuous integration.

What we can offer you:

As well as the opportunity to work on projects that you enjoy in an environment you’ll love, we like to look after our team members at Concirrus. We offer equity and performance based bonuses, regular lunch and learn meetings where the food is on us, great coffee, annual Concirrus Birthday & social events, season ticket loan scheme etc. As a company we are always looking for creative ways to look after our employees and actively encourage them to come to us when they have an idea or need.

About Concirrus Ltd

Concirrus. Intelligent Insurance Solutions for a Connected World.

We are Concirrus. Our Insurtech software brings the world’s information to life by making it useful and accessible to insurers. Every day more and more devices are being connected and managed online (otherwise known as the Internet of Things). This is generating huge amounts of information and represents an enormous opportunity. Yet businesses and people have been unable to utilise this information in any meaningful way and opportunities for progress and efficiency are being lost.

At Concirrus, we create a unique software product to help insurance organisations take advantage of this information. By helping them to harmonise their existing data structures with live information from devices in the physical world, we revolutionise the way they think and act.

With a new set of DNA at their core, and with a revolutionary approach to information processing, machine intelligence and decision making, we are redefining the boundaries of what insurers can achieve.

We hope you can join us.

Concirrus Ltd can only accept applications from candidates who have a valid legal permit or right to work in the United Kingdom. Potential candidates who do not have this right or permit, or are pending an application to obtain this right or permit should not apply as your details will not be processed.

items.title: Senior Automation Tester
items.content:
Who we are

Altus Group is a leading provider of software, data solutions, and independent advisory services to the global commercial real estate industry. Our businesses, Altus Analytics and Altus Expert Services, empower clients to analyze, gain market insight and recognize value on their real estate investments. Headquartered in Canada, we have approximately 2,300 employees around the world, with operations in North America, Europe and Asia Pacific.

The opportunity

Altus Analytics is growing. We are looking for a Senior Automation Tester to join our team of testers. Someone who is an automation best practices leader, and a self-starter. Someone who can share their knowledge, guide their teammates, and coordinate testing tasks. We need a Senior Automation Tester who can show us the full potential of automation testing, and take us beyond the basics. We want a champion and a strategizer. Someone who is accountable, and constantly researching, tweaking, and testing. A Senior Automation Tester who knows their value and the importance of QA and who can liaise with all sides of the business to get the best results.

Who you are

You are an experienced Automation Tester who wants to step up into a Senior role. You enjoy working with big data sets in a MySQL database. We need a Senior Automation Tester who both loves to work in Agile and yet is flexible to adapting methodologies and introducing new techniques to ensure the best work is being done in the most timely manner.

This is a Senior Automation Tester role for someone within an enterprise organization. A chance to move into a startup-like environment, and have your voice heard while introducing processes and change. Someone who enjoys working in small teams, at a fast-pace, in two week sprints, jumping from discussions with product managers and developers to mentoring team members. Someone with outstanding communication, the ability to stand their ground on well researched opinions, and a go-get-it-done attitude.

What does your future look like?

This is an opportunity to increase your skills as a people leader and a chance to be a key contributor on a brand new platform that will be used on a global scale. This is a role for an Automation Tester who wants to build the automation testing processes and influence the implementation of best practices. Someone who wants to be supported in their career aspirations.

Here’s what our Senior Automation Tester will do:

- Voice their opinion. Present logical arguments for and against automation processes in place, automation tools, and automation tasks.
- Develop and maintain the existing automated test framework, ensuring that it is stable and reliable.
- Manage the nightly automated test build.
- Co-ordinate the automation tests tasks within the team, including code management and review.
- Work with other members of the QA Team to develop automation across all areas of the system including financial reports, database, UI and Excel integration.
- Provide support and training in automation to other members of the QA team.
- Actively participate in weekly meetings; set and meet weekly sprint deliverables.
- Work alongside the development team and product management team to resolve all issues as efficiently as possible.
- Raise bugs and errors and communicate with developers to determine resolution.
- Work with product team for clarification on requirements and functionality.
- Conduct research, suggest solutions, and generally do whatever it takes.

Who are you?

- A Senior Automation Tester or a Sr.Automation QA looking for a step up. You want to lead - and build - the process, mentor the team, and continue to work side-by-side doing hands-on testing.
- A Computer Science grad. You know how to approach testing in a Java environment with SQL databases using our essential tools Cucumber, Selenium and Webdriver.
- Well-rounded. You have exposure to multiple products and tools. You have a range of experience implementing and maintaining an automation testing framework and you are able to offer guidance and advice based on deep knowledge of automation testing techniques and tools.
- Not intimidated by large data sets. Our system is a very large data management system. You have experience working with data centric applications systems and you are comfortable with MySQL (or similar technologies).
- A research geek. You enjoy researching new methodologies and clearly presenting reasoning for alternate technologies or processes.
- Methodical, analytical, and detail oriented. You are a logical thinker; yet you are incredibly adept at thinking of all possible answers. You love the meticulous nature of going through every aspect of a product, every line of code, to ensure we are only releasing the best.
- An outstanding communicator. You have superior communication skills. You are concise, on point, and effective. You know how to listen and how to be heard. You are able to communicate both user requirements and technical details clearly across the team.
- An innovative problem-solver. You are flexible, but process-focused and you know how to balance urgency with long-term payoff. You are on a continuous search for improvements. You are never in a panic but you know how to get work done quickly, and accurately. Integrity of test results is your priority.

Need any more reasons to want to work with us?

As we continue to grow, the possibilities for the people that join Altus Analytics are significant. From professional growth to innovation to collaboration we are committed to continuing to foster the right environment to help our people realize their full potential. We give our people the freedom and responsibility to take charge of their career path, bring new ideas to the forefront and work on critical projects that will shape the success of our clients.

We thank you in advance for taking the time to learn more about what makes Altus a great place to spend time doing some of your best work. Apply now, refer a friend or stay on top of what’s new by following us on LinkedIn.

items.title: Omnivore.io: POS Integration Developer
items.content:
POS Integration Developer

Posted Apr 21

Omnivore.io
Headquarters: San Francisco Bay Area
http://omnivore.io/

About Omnivore 

Omnivore provides a universal REST API for restaurant point of sale (POS) integration. Data and functionality is normalized across major POS systems into a single interface, allowing developers to integrate once and run everywhere.

Working at Omnivore 

Work in a fast-paced, growing, and distributed startup focused on providing the best restaurant development platform in the world. Omnivore's API is the backbone for hundreds of applications solving problems around online ordering, payment, instant gift redemption, deep restaurant analytics, and more. Our world class team provides these apps with the tools, functionality, knowledge, and stability they need go from concept to production, and allow them to deploy with support for many POS back-ends while only integrating once.

You'll do well here if you:

  • Enjoy working with a variety of technologies
  • Have strong attention to detail
  • Are passionate about quality (both code and product)
  • Communicate well in a distributed team environment
  • Are self-motivated and driven

We hire for culture, passion, and the ability to learn quickly above specific experience or previous knowledge.

Job Specifics 

Work with our Integration Team to build and maintain integrations with various POS systems. Work with a wide variety of technologies across multiple POS systems on a daily basis. No previous experience with POS systems necessary.

Required

  • 3+ years professional development experience
  • Comfortable working with multiple programming languages
  • Strong foundation in Object Oriented design

Recommended (more is better)

  • Previous success in a remote work environment
  • Previous full-stack development experience
  • Experience with Python on Windows
  • Comfortable with git
  • Working knowledge of one or more RDBMS (mySQL, SQL Server, etc)
  • Previous integration experience with one or more POS systems
  • BS or better in Computer Science
  • Self-taught individuals with strong work experience are still welcome to apply

Benefits

  • Medical
  • Dental
  • 401k
  • Stock options
  • Untracked PTO plan
  • Coworking subsidy

Apply for this position

US residents apply here: http://jobs.omnivore.io/apply/aD7Ovh/Integration-Developer

items.title: Iterative Integration Engineer at Christian Care Ministry (Melbourne, FL) (allows remote)
items.content:
Iterative Integration Engineer

Christian Care Ministry

Job Description

Christian Care Ministry is committed to serving the Lord and our membership with excellence. Christian Care Ministry is a community of believers committed to connecting and equipping Christian’s to share their lives, faith, talents and resources with others, much like the early church did in Acts (Acts 2:42-47).

This position serves on the New Product Engineering Team. That small sub-department of our IT team (under 10 people) is mostly remote.  Their main focus has been making some dreams of the leadership team come true [well, at least the problems that can be solved with code ;-) ]. 

The ideal candidate either has a college degree in computer science, or if not, 2+ years of recent, solid professional programming experience. Our especially ideal candidate has experience in writing tests, specifically front end test JS libraries like Mocha, Jasmine, Jest, or Cucumber. Extra bounty for experience using Selenium.  

Our stack contains a very healthy Isomorphic JavaScript client utilizing Heroku, NodeJS, ReactJS, and a few others.  For our mobile apps we’re using React Native, because, well, basically, it’s awesome (and we really think our philosophies of “API First” and “Learn Once, Code Everywhere” are going to be the norm in the near future).  Our backend and API servers use Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL, Redis and, again, a few others.

Skills & Requirements

 Essential Duties:

  • Write and maintain automated regression tests
  • Validate the other, non-automated areas that need testing work as expected
  • Regularly complete agreed upon workload in agreed upon timeframe
  • Skills we’re looking for:
  • Appreciate non-precise requirements, even if that means re-work
  • Because of our team dynamics, equally enjoy both working independently or cooperatively
  • Transparency with “work in progress” and time tracking
  • Enjoy writing self-documenting code
  • A very thorough person, who enjoys writing tests

PERKS:

  • Work alongside believers who are passionate about serving one another with the gifts and talents God has given to us.
  • Prayer. As an employee of CCM, you’ll have many opportunities to pray with fellow co-workers and members. Prayer is a vital part of the ministry here at CCM (James 5:13-16), and each employee must be comfortable participating in or leading prayer on a regular basis.

States we employ in:

  • Alabama
  • Colorado

  • Illinois

  • Texas
  • Virginia
